ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] fear kiting
ygData.msgSnippet: I m really big on using Pixie Strike to keep them still for a moment while I prep the fear and chain.  Either by hitting them with chains to pull, pixie and
ygData.messageBody:
I'm really big on using Pixie Strike to keep them still for a moment
while I prep the fear and chain. Either by hitting them with chains to
pull, pixie and then fear/chain till they both stick then start the
abuse. Works really well, especially in Kunark with it's wide open
spaces and seemingly pathetic resist rates. Just hit 32 (aww yea) so
don't know the high level viability of that addition tho. And I only
ever can work in 2 songs because of resists on either side. But then
again I'm one of those "oh, 85 cha is enough of a base" bards *doh*.

Ninev Rudefulte
32nd Chorus of Karana
E'Ci

--- Sylly Songsynger <jgs@...> wrote:
> Gilgurth has the right idea. When I did a lot of work with fear &
> chains
> (45- thru 50), I had plenty of opportunity to observe and test
> different
> methods. Usually, I try to fear first, then chain. I'd rather have
> them
> moving away albeit at high speed than coming at me slowly beating on
> me.

[sneep]

> Sylly
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Daryl Schwemley" <drs@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, June 07, 2000 8:29 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] fear kiting
>
>
> > I'm not of appropriate level to fear kite yet, but from what I've
> read,
> the
> > suggestion is to twist only fear and chains, that way if you get a
> resist,
> > you can immediately fear again and get a second shot. Someone with
> more
> > know should be able to answer, but I thought I'd pass on what I've
> read.
> >
> > Gilgurth
> > Bard of 24 Winces
> > E'ci
